                   .:                     :,                                          
,:::::::: ::`      :::                   :::                                          
,:::::::: ::`      :::                   :::                                          
.,,:::,,, ::`.:,   ... .. .:,     .:. ..`... ..`   ..   .:,    .. ::  .::,     .:,`   
   ,::    :::::::  ::, :::::::  `:::::::.,:: :::  ::: .::::::  ::::: ::::::  .::::::  
   ,::    :::::::: ::, :::::::: ::::::::.,:: :::  ::: :::,:::, ::::: ::::::, :::::::: 
   ,::    :::  ::: ::, :::  :::`::.  :::.,::  ::,`::`:::   ::: :::  `::,`   :::   ::: 
   ,::    ::.  ::: ::, ::`  :::.::    ::.,::  :::::: ::::::::: ::`   :::::: :::::::::

   ,::    ::.  ::: ::, ::`  ::: ::: `:::.,::   ::::  :::`  ,,, ::`  .::  :::.::.  ,,, 
   ,::    ::.  ::: ::, ::`  ::: ::::::::.,::   ::::   :::::::` ::`   ::::::: :::::::. 
   ,::    ::.  ::: ::, ::`  :::  :::::::`,::    ::.    :::::`  ::`   ::::::   :::::.  
                                ::,  ,::                               ``             
                                ::::::::                                              
                                 ::::::                                               
                                  `,,`


http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1519726
E3d Volcano, 2nd 40mm Fan Duct - Independent Extruder and Print Cooling by JasonPaulBennett is licensed under the Creative Commons - Attribution license.
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

# Summary

I designed this 40 mm fan mount to work with my highly modified Z18. It mounts to the E3d Volcano hot end cooling fan shroud and will clear a Bondtech extruder. Maybe it will work on your custom 3d printer. 

I sized the holes for 4-40 x 3/4‚Äù socket head cap screws which work for both fans and the center support disk should just pop out. There is also a 2 piece version if you have a tight fit like me.

I printed this in ABS with a 0.6mm nozzle, 1/3mm layers and no support material. PLA and a 0.4mm or 0.5mm nozzle should work great as well.

Made in Rhino using T-Splines. 

[JasonPaulBennett.com](http://jasonpaulbennett.com/)
